newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Shell eyes Venezuela gasoline market.
newsitem.headline: Shell eyes Venezuela gasoline market.

text.p: Shell hopes to take a share of the Venezuelan gasoline retail market if it opens to foreign competition, but only if there is a level playing field for all market participants, Shell Venezuela president Bernard Wheelahan told journalists on Tuesday.
The government has proposed a law that would open the domestic market completely, but some Congressmen have proposed a much more conservative legislation which the government has called "statist".
"International investors need to have the same conditions as Deltaven (the state-owned oil subsidiary)," Wheelahan said at a press conference.

"It is our expectation that the government is going to have a transition period from a controlled market to a totally free market and I think the law will set aside one year. We in Shell agree with this."

In a separate interview, the president of the senate Energy and Mines Committee, Virgilion Avila Vivas, said he expected the internal market law to be passed by Congress in July and saw full competition by the end of the year.
Shell already has a three percent share of Venezuela's lubricants market and has just completed a new $10 million blending plant in Valencia to supply this network.
